attributes.comment:
We are in the process of adopting a child from China and what started out as a 12-
month process has not turned into a 22-month process. We would urge the
USCIS not to raise its fees for the biometrics and I-600A filings. This proposed
increase places a prohibitive cost on families adopting children internationally,
many of whom are middle income families.

The fact that we even need to refile our I-600A because it will expire due to the
increased timeline of the adoptin process is ridiculous. Add to that the increase
in the fees is unfair and burdensome. Funds that should be used to prepare our
home for our child will now have to be diverted for payment of a second (and
possibly higher) fee.

As taxpayers and constituents of your agency, we would urge you to reject the
increase in the biometrics and I-600A fees.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Cathy Ziemba
